features: PERFECT FOR DORMS - The TS-20 Handheld steamer is the most compact garment steamer in the market, making it perfect for dorms and for travel.
WRINKLE-FREE - Strong 210F steam releases wrinkles and refreshes all fabric types: linen, cotton, denim, rayon, silk, lace, even suede!
CONTINUOUS STEAM - 600 watts of strong consistent steam to keep your clothes wrinkle free & fresh!
TRAVEL READY - Lightweight, compact design is perfect for looking go on the go!
MOST COMPACT IN THE MARKET - Weighing at only 1.43 lbs with dimensions of 6.5in x 4.13 in x 8.62 in, it's the lightest and most compact travel hand held steamer in the market

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: True & Tidy TidySteam Hand Held Garment Steamer True & Tidy's Handheld Garment Steamer has an upgraded boiling system with 600 watts of powerful steam. It has a bigger water inlet for easier water filling an re-filling. The stainless steel steam nozzle lets you press on fabrics easily, and the 90° handle safety lock secures the handle in place.

Is it dual voltage? No, the steamer is not dual voltage. It's 110-120V. Can I use this to steam at any angle? No, it can only be used to steam vertically. Please do not tilt the steamer while using to prevent being burned by hot water. Can I use tap water on this steamer? We highly recommend using distilled water in your steamer to prolong its life and to prevent mineral build-up caused by hard water (tap water). How long is the power cord? The TS-20A has an 8ft long power cord

Previous page The TS-20A has a powerful 600 watts of steam and is easy to use. TS-20A is the most compact garment steamer in the market, weight only 1.43 lbs, 6.5 x 4.13 x 8.62 in The 90 degree safety handle lock keeps the handle in place, making it safe to use the steamer. Big Water Tank Opening With a bigger water tank opening for easier water filling and refilling. True & Tidy's TS-20 Tidy Steam Hand Held Garment Steamer comes with a fabric brush and a water cup. Next page 1 Strong 600 watts of steam 2 Most Compact Steamer 3 90° Handle Safety Lock 4 Large Water Tank Opening 5 What's in the Box?
Works with Most Fabric Types and Comes in Vibrant Color Packaging

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel or for everyday use
reviews.reviewText: Cute little no frills steamer that is the perfect size to stick in an overnight bag. Works great

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ok Portable steamer
reviews.reviewText: It’s ok, if you need a portable steamer for a reason it will work, just be prepared as it will take a while to heat up, and it takes a while to get rid of wrinkles. Unless you need a small steamer, I’d look elsewhere, otherwise it does work, just not as powerful or fast as the regular size ones on the market. The extras are also nice features, but the steamer is just ok.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Puts out a lot of steam and works well, has a bit of a learning curve
reviews.reviewText: This steamer works really well to remove the wrinkles in clothes, it's just very different than ironing so you have to use it a few times to figure out how to make it work the best. You need to let it warm up for a minute or two before using it and it's best to steam the clothes while they are hanging vertically, but once you've used it a few times and worked out your process, it's great. It's pretty easy to damage your clothes while ironing, or have the iron leave marks on the fabric, using the steamer reduces those risks.The included lint brush is a nice accessory to remove lint and dog hair from clothes while you are steaming them. The steam seems to loosen it a bit and make it easier to remove. The laundry bag is decent quality, I won't use it day to day, but will toss it in my suitcase to use while traveling.I recommend this steamer and will definitely use it in place of my iron on items that the iron might damage. Plus I feel like steaming the clothes helps sanitize clothes a bit and gets out any odors from pets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This steamer does produce steam but doesn't work very well to steam out wrinkles. I've used several steamers over the years and I've never had one take so long, use so much water, and turn out looking like it barely made any difference in the garment. Not worth it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I got this for the steamer and love it! The extras are great too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great - just wish it steamed a little longer
reviews.reviewText: Great little steamer. Just wish the steam lasted longer before you have to refill it. I was steaming silk pillowcases and it would only do one. Two would be preferable. But it does the job well, is easy to hold and use. Took the wrinkles out of my silk pillowcases nicely and safely. One other thing I wish it came with was a carrying bag for travel. It does come with a laundry bag, but a travel bag for the steamer itself would be better I think.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does the job for steaming curtains.
reviews.reviewText: I got this item to steam the curtains in my inlaws house. It works great; does the job and is a lot faster than ironing them. I was worried it would be too small to be efficient, but instead it's a very comfortable size to hold and use while not making the job seem cumbersome. The included laundry bag is a great bonus; you never have too many of these to carry laundry from the 2nd floor down to the basement and vice versa.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not very effective when compared to other steamers
reviews.reviewText: If this is the first time you've used a travel-sized garment steamer, then this one will probably be OK in your opinion. However, while it barely works, it's not without frustration. True, I'm comparing it to the previous steamer I had, which stopped working recently. This steamer takes much longer to heat up, was much less obvious when it was ready, and overall made a fairly quick task take much longer than needed.My previous travel steamer was a $20 Black and Decker brand. It heated up much faster than this one...like by several minutes. When it was ready, you could see steam billowing out. Not so with this one...it was barely noticeable, which left me wondering whether or not it was actually ready and powerful enough to do the job. Steaming a garment probably take me a good 50%-100% MORE time with this one, than my previous travel steamer. You're probably better off with different, more powerful steamer. Or an iron.To its credit though, it is travel-sized and able to be easily transported with you. That's probably the best thing about it honestly.

As I was travelling for work the window for returns closed and I could not find a way to get in touch with Amazon. The first and only time I used the travel steamer it spluttered hot water everywhere because inside of the chamber the water was boiling. Very dangerous and after checking, faulty! There should be an intermediary step where you can discuss a genuine concern for a faulty item. Is there one that I am not aware of? What about warranty?
